intro: Pleiarina caroliniana, commonly known as the Carolina pleiarina, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive tubular corona. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
